Module org.TRPGF
Package org.TRPGF

Class Screen

java.lang.Object
org.TRPGF.Screen
public class Screen extends Object
This class is used to create the GUI that the player is going to use.

  • Method Details

    • getSingleInstance

      public static Screen getSingleInstance​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Returns the single instance of the constructor for the GUI of the framework
      Parameters:
      stage - Use the stage object given byt the JavaFX Start class

    • startingScreen

      public void startingScreen​(String gameTitle, String startingText)
      This is the starting screen. Here you can show the title of the game and some intro text
      Parameters:
      gameTitle - is the title/name of the game.
      startingText - this is the intro text that the player will see. I advise you use a text file and a file reader to avoid long text strings in your code.

    • tableScreen

      public void tableScreen()
      This creates the table screen where the actual game is played. Here the dialog and character info is displayed and choices are made

    • addTableScreenMap

      public void addTableScreenMap​(String mapName, String imageFilePath)
      Adds a map to your game for the player. The image must be a BMP, GIF, JPEG or PNG. Max height: 640px, max width: 360px.
      Parameters:
      mapName - The name of the map
      imageFilePath - The file path for the image.

    • characterScreen

      public void characterScreen​(String displayedText)
      This creates the character creation screen. is what comes after the starting screen
      Parameters:
      displayedText - text that is shows on this screen.

    • addEndingScreen

      public void addEndingScreen​(int endingScreenId, String sceneText, boolean startOver, boolean exit)
      For creating ending screens, you can have multiple of these.
      Parameters:
      endingScreenId - is the id of this endingScreen.
      sceneText - the text that is shown on this ending screen.
      startOver - is a boolean value that lets you dice if you want there to be a staring over button that leads to the starting screen.
      exit - is a boolean value that lets you dice if you want there to be an exit button that closes the application.

    • finishEndingScreens

      public void finishEndingScreens()
      Writes the endings to the JSON file. This function must be written at the end of the addEndingScreen function.
